newsitem.title: INDIA: BRISK DEMAND AT CALCUTTA TEA AUCTION.
newsitem.headline: BRISK DEMAND AT CALCUTTA TEA AUCTION.

text.p: There was good demand for most grades at the Calcutta tea auction this week, traders said on Friday.
In all 2.34 million kg, including 233,124 kg of Darjeeling tea, were on offer.

In CTC variety, plain and medium brokens were dearer by two to four rupees while fannings were dearer by three to four rupees. There were some export inquiries for fannings and small liquoring brokens, traders said.
In Orthodox variety, the demand from the Middle East countries was strong. Commonwealth of Independent State countries also lent good support.
